citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Animals appeared healthy during inspection, however in their large natural winter habitat a method and process for
observing the animals daily (mainly on weekends) is not in place by staff/trained personnel. Daily observations of animals
is important and required to ensure that any problems of animal health or well-being can be conveyed to the attending
veterinarian in a timely manner. Ensure that a process and routine is in place so that daily observations of animals can be
accomplished.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license for Site 002. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted
with the facility representatives.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 3/8/2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Animals appeared healthy during inspection, however in their large natural winter habitat a method and process for 
observing the animals daily (mainly on weekends) is not in place by staff/trained personnel. Daily observations of animals 
is important and required to ensure that any problems of animal health or well-being can be conveyed to the attending 
veterinarian in a timely manner. Ensure that a process and routine is in place so that daily observations of animals can be 
accomplished. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license for Site 002. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted 
with the facility representatives. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 3/8/2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
